metadata.title: CVE-2022-0396 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
BIND 9.16.11 -> 9.16.26, 9.17.0 -> 9.18.0 and versions 9.16.11-S1 ->9.16.26-S1 of the BIND Supported Preview Edition. Specifically crafted TCPstreams can cause connections to BIND to remain in CLOSE_WAIT status for anindefinite period of time, even after the client has terminated theconnection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0396` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
bind9-host - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
bind9-libs - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
bind9-utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
bind9utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.9').
